abstract: New York State Assembly introduces new 'paperless chamber,' in which legislators will now review bills and other documents through touchscreen tablets; bill is intended to modernize chamber and save taxpayers on paper costs, but tablets have only limited Internet access.
lead_paragraph: In an effort to go paperless, the Assembly established itself as “an electronic chamber,” complete with tablet computers, touch screens and exceptionally limited web surfing.

headline.main: Turning Over a New Leaf, New York Assembly Pushes Paper Out and Adopts Tablets
headline.print_headline: Turning Over a New Leaf, Assembly Pushes Paper Out and Adopts Tablets

snippet: In an effort to go paperless, the Assembly established itself as “an electronic chamber,” complete with tablet computers, touch screens and exceptionally limited web surfing.
